name: Channel alteration from imagery
functionStatement: Channel and floodplain structure supply depth, velocity, substrate diversity, and vegetation to support native organisms through all life stages.
descriptionMarkdown: Backwater areas are accessible as nursery/refuge if historically present, unless naturally confined.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare current imagery to historical imagery or maps to estimate percent of reach straightened, ditched, or hardened. Map hardened bank length where visible.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 0-10% of reach altered, and banks are predominantly natural.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 25-50% altered, with major loss of natural planform or extensive hardening.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >50% altered, or reach is ditch-like or heavily hardened.
